The current password is not displayed here. Use this field to change the current password without it being displayed.

This field is used only when Squiz Matrix attempts to authenticate an LDAP user for logging in. If this is set, this DN will be used to search for the user being authenticated. If this field is left blank, the Base DN will also be used for authentication. This is an advanced option; in most cases, this field should be left blank.

An Auth Filter will be used when Squiz Matrix attempts to authenticate an LDAP user for logging in. If "Use Default Filter" is enabled, a default filter of "({User ID}=%username%)" will be used. Disable this setting to enter a custom Auth Filter to be used. This is an advanced option; in most cases, the "Use Default Filter" can be left enabled.

Allow the LDAP bridge to recursively return all parent groups of an LDAP user when the user logs in Matrix. These parent groups are used by Squiz Matrix's permission system. Disable this option to speed up the login process by only retrieving a user's immediate parent groups.

Setting this value to 'On', will enable caching for the LDAP result and bring the Cache Expiry setting into effect. The Caching Status on the Cache Manager must also be enabled in order for this setting to take effect.

The length of time an LDAP result cache entry is valid in seconds. Memcache storage type accepts maximum 2592000 (30 days). When this value is set to zero or not supplied, the cached LDAP result will expire after the "Default Expiry" period set on the Cache Manager.
